doc.after: The giant anteater is native to Central and South America. Its known range stretches from Honduras to northern Argentina, and fossil remains have been found as far north as northwestern Sonora, Mexico.[7] It is largely absent from the Andes[4] and has been extirpated in Uruguay.[2] It may also be extirpated in Belize, Costa Rica and Guatemala.[2] The species can be found in a number of habitats including both tropical rainforests and xeric shrublands,[11] provided enough prey is present to sustain it.[22]
